pr_title: K8s compatible liveness and readiness probes OKAPI-904

timeline.message:
K8s compatible liveness and readiness probes OKAPI-904

New configuration healthPort which when set and non-zero enables that Okapi
listens on that port and offers /readiness and /liveness services.. Both of
which returns 204 No Content on success. 500 on failure.

timeline.author: craigmcnally

replies.bodyText:
isAlive() succeeds if the list is empty, contains the supertenant only, or contains any number of tenants.
If only fails if the database query fails.
replies.author: julianladisch

timeline.bodyText: The method should be renamed to testPortReadinessPort0 and port = 0 been used. Then we can delete testPort0.
timeline.author: julianladisch

replies.bodyText: if port = 0, then this test will start failing.. There won't be a response to /readiness, then.
replies.author: adamdickmeiss

timeline.bodyText: This should be renamed to testPortReadinessPort9130. Then we can remove testPortOK.
timeline.author: julianladisch

timeline.bodyText: The list should be [IsAlive(), IsNotAlive()] to test that it not only checks the first one.
timeline.author: julianladisch
julianladisch
julianladisch

timeline.bodyText: Should we also log the exception (message + stacktrace) on failure? One reason might be that the database query fails. This should also be in the log, not only in the HTTP body.
timeline.author: julianladisch

timeline.bodyText: The if clause should be move to the first line to avoid storing livenessChecks if they are not needed.
timeline.author: julianladisch
